info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 8:54AM EDT until April 7 at 1:01AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Flatrock River at Saint Paul.
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana...
Haw Creek near Clifford.
Fall Creek at Millersville.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Fall Creek at Millersville.
* WHEN...Until early Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Extensive flooding along Fall Creek. Local roads are flooded. Building northeast of gaging site can be flooded by a few feet of water if flood protection fails.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM EDT Saturday was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.3 feet this evening. It will then fall just after midnight tonight. It will rise to 12.3 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around midnight EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING
